page.title: 08A TIBETAN TEMPLE
page.content: Towards the end of the 1970's it became clear obvious that enlarged facilities were essential , and so the Samye Project came into being,the construction of a Tibetan temple after the style of original Samye monastry consisting of three floors each in distinctive Tibetan style. The work is in two phases.The first phase consists of the construction of the actual Shrine room and two smaller floors to provide accomodation to visiting lamas and to house various relics.The shell of this building is now complete. Phase 2 will be the construction of the wings of the monastry,providing student accomodation, lecture ,therapy and translation rooms.Two libraries one for tibetan and the other for English works and space for video and tape archives.
